Herbal Tea Remedy: Create a blend of herbs such as ginger, peppermint, and eucalyptus, known for their natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties. Use this tea as a substitute for over-the-counter cold medicines to help alleviate symptoms.
Saltwater Gargle: Gargling with saltwater can help reduce swelling in the throat and ease congestion. Mix 1/4 teaspoon of salt in 8 ounces of warm water and gargle several times a day.

Humidifier Therapy: Dry air can exacerbate cold symptoms. Use a humidifier to add moisture to the air, helping to loosen and clear mucus from the nasal passages. This can also help soothe a sore throat and promote better sleep.

Chicken Soup Therapy: Chicken soup has been a go-to remedy for colds for centuries. Its steam can help loosen mucus and reduce inflammation in the nasal passages. You can make a simple chicken soup by boiling chicken breast in water with vegetables like onions, carrots, and celery.

Aromatherapy: Certain essential oils, such as eucalyptus, peppermint, and lavender, have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties. Use a diffuser to inhale these oils, or apply them topically to the chest or under the nose to help alleviate cold symptoms.
